Is GRE or GMAT required for admission? Applicants with a GPA above 2.5 are not required to take GRE or GMAT. For applicants whose GPA is between 2.0 and 2.5, a GRE or GMAT will be required. Do I need an undergraduate degree related to science or engineering to apply for MS-ADS at USD? Even though it is expected that applicants acquire their bachelor’s degrees in any STEM field (science, technology, engineering or mathematics), the program is also open to those with a bachelor’s degree from any other field.

Rankings The University of San Diego, established in 1949, is a highly rated private, Catholic university that regularly earns accolades and honors from academic websites and publications. USD citations include: The Princeton Review #6 Most Beautiful Campus #8 Best Quality of Life #14 Most Popular Study Abroad Program #17 Best-run Colleges #24 Top 50 Green Colleges U.S. News & World Report #13 Best Undergraduate Engineering Programs #19 Best Online Graduate Criminal Justice Programs #56 Best Colleges for Veterans #63 Best Value Schools #88 National Universities #90 Best Business Programs #97 Best Undergraduate Business Programs Business Insider

About MS-ADS The Master of Science in Applied Data Science at University of San Diego (USD MS-ADS) program is a 20-month professional master’s program in Data Science, designed in collaboration with key industry stakeholders to offer cutting-edge curriculum taught by active industry experts. The program was launched in September 2020 and is offered online through USD’s Shiley-Marcos School of Engineering. USD MS-ADS program’s mission is to equip graduates with the technical strategies and skills they will use to apply powerful and modern analytical tools to real-world applications.

Interview Resources In this section, we will provide materials that help you land a job in data science field, from the most frequently asked questions in data science interviews to templates to get you started when writing to hiring managers. These materials are the one-stop resources from where you can boost your interview preparation, including questions on programming basics to statistical analysis and machine learning, which will help you with different expertise levels to reap the maximum benefit.

Materials The following is a list of online courses and other resources that might be useful preparation for the MS ADS program. Completion of these courses does not replace the official program prerequisites. Rather, this page is mainly intended for prospective or entering students who may wish to reinforce their preparation before the program starts. • Python • R • SQL • Data Visualization • SAS • Microsoft Excel

Our Vision The goal of the USD MS-ADS online program is to prepare prospective data scientists with in-depth analytical knowledge tied to real-world applications, relevant programming ability, and critical professional skills to both succeed in their career and to create meaningful social impact. The many additional areas now impacted by data science include: marketing, sales and service, the life sciences, business intelligence, agriculture, mining, oil, aerospace, travel, transportation, food, field service, construction, defense, digital media, education and more.

Workshops OCTOBER 2020 Workshop Overview: a free and guided virtual workshop presented in partnership between the University of San Diego’s Applied Data Science Master’s Program and San Diego Tech Hub. The free 3-part, 90-minute virtual workshop series will develop data science skills, help advance your career, and drive social change. Don’t worry if you are a beginner, there is no requirement for previous programming experience as all the foundational languages (Python, R), skills, and tools (Tableau) will be taught during the workshops.
